text_en:
Without the greenhouse effect, the earth would freeze, so it exists in the first place and is not harmful to humans; but after the industrial revolution, humans destroyed its balance and made the greenhouse effect too much.
There is really this ironic thing in the history of immunology: after soap was invented and people's living environment was greatly improved, the number of autoimmune diseases increased, and there were deaths from "originally very common and weak bacterial infections." The number of people has also increased because the acquired immunity of the immune system cannot be trained.

author: YT W
text_en:
First, after the experiment, you will also need to explain the content of the textbook, with practice questions, exercises and study sheets, as well as review homework and review test papers. How many lessons do you plan to complete this chapter?
Second, has your class been screened? Is it so obedient for a normally divided class to enter the laboratory? Don't spend time managing order? No need to spend time repeating it the second time and the third time? Ask them to write a study sheet and they will do it? Wouldn't someone play badly with others? When there is no camera or when the teacher next to you is observing, the student's degree of cooperation is so high?
Third, although I have never taught Sanduo Middle School, I can be sure that the quality of Ma Sanduo Middle School is not bad just by looking at the content, otherwise this class has been specially selected. Otherwise, ordinary classes will not be able to lead students to explore and design experiments as smoothly as in the film.
Fourth, I think that the majority of show-making elements, just like the public observation of classes now, there will always be only the teacher who can play tricks the most, and the rest of the time is crazy rushing to class. Unless your service school has no list pressure, then of course you can just teach the textbooks. Especially if the junior high school teachers in the south-central counties and cities donâ€™t teach more, enrolling students will be troublesome in the future~

author: Linç·¯è±ˆ
text_en:
I understand what the teacher said, and I didn't believe it before I had used this method.
In the past four classes (not including the eighth section), I was too in a hurry to finish the textbook content and explain the examination papers and exercises. How could it be possible to return to the laboratory.
So I also had a period of teaching time when I didnâ€™t believe in "experiments."
At that time, the more teachers and students entered the classroom, the more annoying they became.
.
In the past, I taught at a school in New Taipei where there was a considerable gap between urban and rural culture.
(EX: I donâ€™t know what the "Big Hero Group" is, I donâ€™t know who is Hugh Jackman,
A group of children who have never even seen a "movie",
Oh yes,
Normally when absent from class for no reason,
It's cognizant to come to sleep)
I'm not sure how bad the "quality" of the students the teacher is facing is, and I don't think "compared to who is worse" is any help!
#The number of tutoring students in each class is definitely less than 1/2 because the family's financial situation does not allow it
.

In the past few years, I participated in the seminars held by LIS dubiously, and brought up the problems encountered at the scene for everyone to discuss.
Try to put the film in the classroom, whether it is to raise motivation, wake up the student, or reward the exam
(There is no projection screen in the classroom)
According to the teacher, at that time, the experiment was used to make students like and look forward to taking physics and chemistry classes again, and the practice of returning home exercises went from rejection to active completion.
I use the next semester of the eighth grade to make changes,
Mainly in the laboratory, supplemented by classroom exercises, complete the chapters on molar number, acid-base, and even strength that many students find difficult.
Regardless of whether there is a teacher or a camera, the students are busy looking for surprises and discoveries for them in the experiment, not to mention whether there is a teacher next to them, or even noticing that the class bell has been struck.
The exaggeration is that students will take the initiative to pick up physical and chemical topics to write in other back courses.
# Believe it or not, I believe in the efforts of the students
.
As for the grades, there were a total of six semesters that year. Except for the unfamiliar first semester, the rest were all in the first half of the grade.
I know the teacher will say that it is just right or assigned to a good class.
May I ask, will a newcomer and unfamiliar agent teacher give him a better-quality class? Or will he give him a trustworthy official teacher with a good level?
By the way, those three classes are going to take the exam this year, and I will share with the teacher how much this kind of experimental teaching is helpful to the students, especially in the second half.
.

Finally, I believe that this set of teaching materials LIS is to help teachers go more smoothly in class.
It is impossible to copy it in full and then go straight to the class without modification.
Give students a little opportunity and feel a little different. My own experience is that students really change from being extremely passive to being active.
#A film is less than 10 minutes, if you want to show the laboratory class, I think 2 hours will not be enough to show.
Teachers are welcome to come and discuss together to make students better and make learning more efficient.

author: YT W
text_en:
@LIS Situational Science Textbook
Thank you for your response, then please don't make the title so beautiful next time, because using a class that has been selected or specially trained has the advantage of putting it in the experimental class.
Next time, please stay in a general community country (that is, not a star school like yours, or a school with high-quality students). You can choose some well-known rogue schools (in order not to damage the reputation of the school, please do your own homework. Everyone is inside the circle, just ask you to know) to do the same course, I want to see the real experimental class.
Sorry, because of the low quality of the students in my service school, I do not believe that your method can be used in other middle or lower middle schools. I still think that you put a lot of effort into "acting", which is simply not possible in ordinary schools.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Thank you for your feedback. These questions are indeed questions that teachers will consider when making teaching changes.
As each scene has a different tone with the child, the dilemma faced by the teacher is also different. Regardless of LIS or co-teachers, the original intention of this series is to use the film as the medium and use the course content as a source of inspiration, so that these discussions and possible solutions can occur in multiple ways.

In order for the film to assist on-site teachers to prepare lessons, the team is looking for teachers who have been on-site for long-term teaching changes. The teachers will make a comprehensive assessment based on past experience, current teaching hours, progress of the stage test, and student level, and design the curriculum together with us. The following three points are shared about the course content within a limited time, the habits and ability of students to conduct experiments, and the pre-work assignments of the course:

1. Course content within a limited time
Under the limit of the number of hours, the balance between teaching completion and teaching is indeed a science.
Taking this class as an example, the learning goal set by the teacher is: "Students acquire the ability to reason, design experiments, and the essence of science." Therefore, with the limited number of lessons in a section exam, if you want to invest here, you will really need The choice is made based on the number of exercise questions in each unit, and the evaluation basis for each teacher's choice will return to the definition and indicators of what a unit teaches "good". Each school, teacher, and parent is different. Under the 108 syllabus, everyone is gradually working hard to make this "good course" not only based on scores as the only evaluation basis (how to adjust the evaluation method to meet the new syllabus, you can discuss it again).

2. The habit and ability of students to conduct experiments
This class is indeed the result of the teacherâ€™s long-term cultivation. From the beginning of the country, the children have been trained to enter the laboratory. After many exercises, they have cultivated a tacit understanding and mode of doing experiments. You can also learn from the instructions and gestures given by the teacher in the film. You can see the clues in the video, it is not because there is a camera or the teacher is on the scene (the scene that day is mainly LIS shooting partners). Of course, we also encountered unexpected situations that day, such as: the students' operation experiments were not as expected, and the children were stuck thinking about what to do. We tried our best to show the teacher's meticulous guidance in the film hours.

3. Course prerequisites
How to make children willing to answer questions and conduct experiments smoothly in class? In the pre-class preparation, the teacher has actually done a lot of work: situation design, question adjustment, and evaluation of the placement of experimental equipment. The purpose is to make the limited Within the number of teaching hours, the students' learning effect can be maximized, and all this is also the daily life of the teacher. Through the feedback of this message, the team also reflected that perhaps in the interview, sharing the thought process during the preparation of the lesson is also very important material.

Thank you again for your heartfelt feedback. We will continue to optimize the content of the video so that the material can assist the on-site teachers to create courses suitable for their classes! If you have any ideas, you are welcome to discuss further~ Thanks!

text_en:
Instructions for people who donâ€™t understand:
Use advancement and abolishment say:
"The acquired traits of organisms will be passed on to the next generation."
According to this theory, children of weightlifters are born with many muscles, so this statement is wrong.
(Note: This name is actually wrong, it will indeed be used, but the acquired influence will not be inherited unless it acts on the germ cells)

Evolution Theory:
"Survival of the fittest, elimination of the unfit"
I believe everyone knows about "gene mutations," so if two organisms, short giraffes and giraffes, are produced due to genetic mutations, short giraffes cannot easily eat leaves, so they will be eliminated (extinct) and only giraffes will remain.

author: Kiwi Bird
text_en:
I am late too (but if you see a message please tell me if I am right or wrong!)

But for the last question, I donâ€™t think the plants will turn into fluorescent plants
Because the roots of plants have the function of a semi-permeable membrane
It is used to filter out things that are useless to plants (soil is an example)
I speculate that the fluorescer will also be filtered out because its molecules are too large

author: æä½³æ˜‡
text_en:
@LIS Situational Science Textbook

So, about the early wave, I can explain that the shock wave is launched in all directions and then causes the "next-door neighbor" to become the new seismic source. After the effect continues to accumulate, it looks like a certain wave is walking in a straight line. (This wave looks like a straight line. In the following situations, I refer to the early wave.) The early wave hits the surface of the Morse surface, and these surfaces also become the source of the earthquake. In addition to continuing to vibrate into the deep layers of the earth, it also shakes Mo "Neighbors No. 1...2...3 of Mohs Mee next door" and "Crustal Neighbors" upstairs (so I guess there will be shock waves being sent back), and the waves going upstairs will eventually Back to the surface.

The focus of my thoughts is here, because the waves are transmitted faster between "Neighbors No. 1, 2, and 3 of the Mohs surface", and these neighbors of the Mohs surface will transmit the shock waves to their respective "buildings" again. The upper crust neighbor" finally reaches the ground, but the "upstairs crust neighbor" transmits waves at a slower speed. The shock wave can be detected if there is an early wave that is in line with the detection station.

So I can probably understand that LIS uses the land letter "superficial highway" to explain it.

If you want to draw animations according to Zhenbo's real life... Then please donate more to the LIS team so that they can draw more powerful animations! ğŸ˜„

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
This phenomenon is a bit abstract to explain, please prepare your imagination XD
As mentioned in the video, "waves will travel in all directions." In the film, the lines with obvious directionality are used to help everyone understand, but in fact, shock waves spread out around themselves all the time, and when the shock waves spread When you go to a place next to it, the place next to it becomes a new seismic source, constantly transmitting shock waves in all directions.
Although in the animation he seems to run up after approaching the observing station, in fact, every point on the discontinuity surface transmits vibration in all directions. The animation only presents the shortest path of the shock wave for easy understanding.
This concept is really a bit abstract, and it takes a lot of effort to explain it clearly, and this concept is actually taught in high schools or even universities. Taking into account various factors, we decided to avoid talking about it, but I didnâ€™t expect it to escape your careful attention. The clever eye of the audience XD
I really have to give everyone a big compliment. If the attitude is good enough, the future of Taiwan depends on you! ! !

LIS Situational Science Textbook After reading your conversations, I feel that LISâ€™s film is like a Dalton mentioning the atom, it is simple and easy to understand and can solve most of the phenomena. And Teacher Chen is like a scientist after Dawton, he put forward contradictions and corrections.

Although "Atomic Theory" has many places that need to be corrected and adjusted in the eyes of modern technology, it provides great directions to help everyone think and discuss, and further pursue the truth.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Hello, Iâ€™m Bi Sheng, LISâ€™s teaching material production director
Thank you for your careful watching and feedback. Here I will explain to you why the team presents the cause and effect of the idea that "density and wave speed are positively correlated" in the video.
When LIS makes science history films, it hopes to present the "thoughts of scientists at the time" so that children can understand and learn how scientists think about things. But when looking for relevant information about Mohs, the team could not find his papers and manuscripts at the time, so it can only use some more credible websites to comment on Mohs, such as the discontinuous English interface of Mohs on Wikipedia. , Khan Academyâ€™s video introducing the discontinuous surface of Mohs, etc., all mentioned that Mohsâ€™ â€œcognition at the timeâ€ believed that density was positively correlated with wave speed. Therefore, we boldly assumed that Mohs believed that â€œdensity and wave speed were Positive correlation" to present the content in the video.
However, it is not pointed out in the film that this concept is actually inconsistent with modern knowledge. It is indeed something we have done imperfectly. We will add relevant information in the information column later.
Thank you very much for your willingness to point out our shortcomings, and I would like to ask you for your advice afterwards, thank you! !

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Hello, thank you in advance for your feedback.
This experiment was originally calculated. After considering factors such as mass, impact area, and pressure per unit area, it was calculated that at a height of 1.15 meters, there was a chance that the glass would break.
However, in actual operation, it was found that the stability of the structure could not be effectively controlled, so the experiment was changed after consideration, instead of directly verifying by the way of potential energy conversion kinetic energy, but as far as possible to confirm that the glass support structure can fully withstand the impact force, and measured How fast can you break the glass, and then reverse how high is needed to convert the potential energy.
In the end, we did not succeed in breaking the glass. We knew that if we had to break it, as long as we continued to reduce the impact area, we would certainly have a chance, and we would be able to figure out how high it would be. But after the test, we think that the impact is enough to hurt people if it has not been successfully broken, so we think that the situation in the movie is not easy to happen in reality.
Of course, there are many accidents in this experiment, which leads to more room for discussion. After the experiment, the team has carefully reviewed and learned from the experience, and promised to be more cautious in designing experiments in the future, and hope that the quality of future movies can regain your favorite.

author: Ruimin Lin
text_en:
The size of the chromosomes is different during division, and the symmetry is really clear.
But it would be nice if you can use 3 pairs of displays when shooting an animation
Students often cannot distinguish between 2 pairs and double sets, mainly because there are only 2 pairs in the textbook picture

After seeing the fifth time, I found that the arrangement of the first division and the second division during meiosis is not correct.
Especially the first split â†’ the pair should be lined up to separate on both sides â†’ this is the true meaning of "symmetry"!
Arrangement is the key to ensure correct separation. Many mutations are caused by problems in arrangement.
It's just that the middle school has removed the details of the division, so I can't see its importance.

text_en:
No special methods are needed. Only a single set of chromosomes can still develop into an embryo, but it will be a very fragile individual with many defects.
As long as the sperm cell and the egg cell are combined, they will become a fertilized egg and start cell division. This process will not be affected by whether the chromosomes are properly combined. Even if there are problems with the chromosomes in the sperm and egg cells, they will continue to develop, like some natural diseases ( Such as Down's syndrome) is caused by the abnormal number of chromosomes when the sperm and egg are combined.

Therefore, we often hear that some natural diseases such as Down's syndrome (one more chromosome) are due to the beginning Caused by defective chromosomes
Only one set of chromosomes can still develop into an embryo, but it will be an embryo full of defects, the kind that is easy to die.

author: Li-wen Liu
text_en:
As the first experience: (in terms of natural science)
Literacy test questions:
There was a literacy test before in the school, which was used as a paragraph test of inquiry and practice, but I think the question is simple for the sake of "literacy", because it gives you some experimental results, short essays, and questions from beginning to end. You manipulate the variable cause and the variable cause. As a result, students who read not many books but have good logic scores are about the same as those who read a lot. In fact, it is a bit unfair to students who work hard...

I suffered a lot from the cross-subject thinking part of the exam questions. I wrote a section of the question extracting classical poetry and asked you about the knowledge of natural sciences. I canâ€™t figure it out because of the poor Chinese language. If I ask directly, I can actually get the answer right. . In this way, the natural score is not also related to the Chinese score, which is a pity for students who are not good at Chinese.

Teaching materials:
The order of basic organisms is cytology, heredity, and evolution, which seems to be modeled on the order of campell. However, I think it is not good to put genetics first. Genetics requires some basic chemistry. In the past years, it was placed in elective organisms. Now it is placed high. 1. In fact, it is very hard for people who are not yet mature in the development of chemistry

In terms of physical chemistry, I'm not listening to QQ

2. Try to collect the month-total rainfall relationship diagram and the clay to sand ratio-rainfall relationship diagram

This kind of education is really training students' thinking ability
Instead of memorizing it by rote
A bunch of people think that a high score is very powerful and smart
But only achieved high scores with short-term memory
There are even people who admire learning skills that are more memorable, but they forget it after a few years. Itâ€™s useless at all.
It can only be said that this kind of examination machine is the product of today's cancer examination-oriented education. It is really sad.
  
What you have thought about and understood is what you really learn
And this kind of study will not be forgotten no matter how long it takes, because when you are asked again, you already have a logical route to consider this question.

author: å»–æŸä¸
text_en:
I think it will become louder first, but after the coil is counted to a certain level, it will become quieter due to insufficient current. After all, the coil itself still has resistance, and the mobile phone does not have that strong current. If the more twisted, the louder the sound, then why should the speaker be plugged in?

It is true that the magnetic field will increase with more turns, and it is also true that the increase of the magnetic field causes the amplitude to increase. However, if the number of turns is large, the resistance will be relatively increased, and the current will be smaller; the current will be smaller, the magnetic field will be smaller; the magnetic field will be smaller, and the amplitude will also be smaller.

author: OAO Albert
text_en:
Liquid nitrogen will spray out from above. I think there are several reasons
1. There is a flattening action at the outlet of the lower water pipe
Increased the resistance when liquid/gaseous nitrogen is ejected
2. For liquid nitrogen, the temperature of the water pipe is much higher than itself
So when liquid nitrogen comes into contact with a high-temperature tube, it will instantly vaporize and generate pressure (nonsense
From an electrical point of view, the relationship between the upper input port and the lower nozzle can be said to be in series. The upward spray resistance is less than the downward flow resistance, so the amount of liquid nitrogen must be sprayed upward.

author: Ruimin Lin
text_en:
Itâ€™s great to see the details of the pea flower experiment.
No need to talk about frothing, students are still full of question marks
But there is a small detail...
"Then brush the purple flower on the pistil..." According to the meaning of this sentence and the subsequent shots, it is reasonable that there should be a white flower in this shot.
Purple flowers with purple flowers are self-flowering (no operation required), purple flowers with white flowers are different flowers (operation required)

But simply change the dubbing and lines "and then brush the white flower pollen on the pistil..." it should be fine.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
In this experiment, the shrink film on the PET bottle is used. At present, the shrink film on the PET bottle is mostly made of PET, which can be heated to about 140 to 160 degrees, and it is safer to not release toxins.
In this experiment, a hair dryer is used to blow, and the temperature is not higher than 140 degrees, so there is no need to worry about the release of toxic substances.
Of course, if you want to test with different thermoplastics when you do your own experiment, you need to pay attention to what kind of material is used and whether there will be any problems~

author: ä¨»Í¤ä¨»Í®
text_en:
The following is an excerpt from "Life Challenge"
https://m.fwdict.com/challenge/

A Taoist person said: "Elder, don't be angry. Because many things taught in folk school education are wrong. Just natural science, the stars, the sun, the moon, or the history of mankind... it's all. Itâ€™s wrong. If you let the elders get in touch with folk education and read a lot of books, Iâ€™m afraid that when you are asked to write the truth about what you have seen in the "underworld", you will have to work more to reverse and persuade your own prejudices. ; Even what you write will add fuel and vinegar and incorporate folk book theories. In this way, the truth of life that [Yin Fu] wants to convey to humans is not pure."

The souls (ghosts) who were still hiding freely at the time of the death of folk humans who were "under age", were unable to return to the underworld, so the method of supplementing the magnetic current was to melt the dew from the magnetostatic current balloon (moon). The magnetic current emitted when the sun evaporates in the early morning is the source of their replenishment. They will lie on the ground and absorb the magnetic current of this dew evaporation. This kind of magnetic current is very small, so some ghosts who are free to hide will voluntarily join the beasts and become workers in the underworld. Although it is hard work, there is a fixed source of magnetic current-they can go back to the underworld to recharge.

I scratched my head and said in distress, "Also, there is no such thing as the "moon" at all, I have to write it down!"
As long as I started to get out of my body and contact Zhong Kui, Zhong Kui told me: The moon in the sky is not the moon that humans imagined.
It turns out that human beings see the "moon" shining in the sky. In the five realms of heaven and earth, the real name is "magnetostatic current balloon."
Oulu pointed to the screen, and the picture was visible below our location, at the top of the third realmâ€”a white luminous sphere. He said, "This is what the folks call the "moon". In fact, it is "white and transparent." The magnetostatic fluid mass" rises to the sky higher than the white clouds, and it attracts the collective to create a denser white, shiny "magnetostatic fluid balloon". Its essence is a transparent gas, which will follow The air drifts."
I asked: "Aren't people among the people who can see the surface of the moon with a space telescope?"
Olu said: "The magnetostatic flow balloon is a transparent gas, and folk humans are exploring the direction of this transparent sphere with instruments. What they happen to see is a mass of garbage (lime mass) floating on the "black cloud plate". Just treat this trash group as the moon."
I asked again, "What is the function of this magnetostatic balloon? Will it illuminate humans at night?"
Oulu laughed: "Maybe this is a collateral effect! The magnetostatic balloon body is the solar battery and the reserve magnetic current; the distance the sun travels from the marsh mud boundary will depend on the needs of the situation-if private emissions If the amount of carbon dioxide is not enough for the sun to use, it is impossible to extract enough solar energy (electricity)-the sun will use the magnetic reserve of the magnetostatic current balloon; it is usually absorbed during the day, so in the strong light of the sun, humans cannot see the static The magneto-fluidic balloon is pushed by a flying saucer to the side of the sun. The sun will melt the magnetostatic balloon and recycle the magnetic fluid into the sun's body for use.â€
I asked curiously: "The flying saucer pushed the moon next to the sun? How to push it? Do you play football?"
Oulu said: "The magnetostatic current balloon was originally floating in the lower layer of the black cloud plate of the Fengyun Spirit World. After the magnetostatic fluid body was entangled, it sank to the upper air of the third realm, and drifted with the airflow; when the sun needs When the power is added, the flying saucer will move the magnetostatic current balloon to the side of the sun; if it happens to be a time when the sunâ€™s rays are weak, it will be seen by civilians as a scene similar to "two suns." As for how the flying saucer is pushed I can tell you that the flying saucer is directly driven into the magnetostatic current balloon."
I asked Oulu, "Isn't the magnetostatic flow balloon gas? How do you push it?"
Oulu: "This is a long story. When the sun revolves and falls in the water world, it will emit the refined fog body-"white transparent magnetohydrostatic body", entangled with the water, and flow together to form an "iceberg". When the sun rises from the exit, the high-temperature cyclone airflow generated by the rotating air of the shell will slowly melt the "iceberg", and then blow the hydrostatic fluids that are bound by the water to melt; "white and transparent Most of the "magnetostatic fluid body" is turned into white mist gas and floats in the air; this magnetic fluid body itself is magnetic and will naturally be entangled into a cluster-called "white clouds"."
I listened carefully. Oulu said that this trip will allow me to witness these processes with my own eyes.
He went on to say: "Those white and transparent magnetostatic fluid masses float up to a height above the white clouds, and are entangled into a "magnetostatic fluid balloon", which is the "moon" seen by the people-but this suction The twisting process is also mysterious."
I described it and said, "Is it like making cotton candy by the folks, twisted into a big pile?"
Oulu said: "The marshmallows need to be wound into a big lump. Doesn't it need a bamboo stick to wind around? The formation of the magnetostatic flow balloon also has a magnetically absorbing hollow membrane ball, which floats all the static magnetism to this height. The fluid body entangles the group. This magnetic ball is made by Sun Xingjun. You can see it with your own eyes later.â€ He operated the button again to let me watch a partial image of the moon. I saw the part outside of the bright white light. Black and gray like a honeycomb, just like the "pumice stone" seen by the folks, it is full of dense holes.
I looked at its appearance in surprise, and asked Oulu: "How big is this ball?"
Oulu adjusted the scale of the screen picture and replied, "It is almost half the size of the sun. However, after it has entangled the white magnetostatic fluid, it is almost as large as the sun; now its magnetostatic fluid attracts There is not much entanglement, so it allows you to see the magnetic ball that has not been fully covered."
"Like cotton candy, the more you wrap, the bigger the cotton candy will be." I think of the cotton candy sold in the social market.
He nodded.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Never put calcium hydroxide in your mouth
The film uses calcium hydroxide and water to release high temperature to cook food
Think about your mouth, it's all saliva
Needless to say, what happens when calcium hydroxide is put in your mouth!


Regarding ingestion (or inhalation) of calcium hydroxide
If the dose is small, it is the same as chewing betel nut (please don't try)
Feel the heat in the mouth and cause irritation to the throat and lungs
(Red betel nut juice or betel nut commonly known as "red gray" contains calcium hydroxide)


If overdose, in addition to burns, there will be symptoms such as difficulty breathing, internal bleeding, muscle breakdown, and increased blood pH, resulting in organ damage.
If you accidentally swallow it, please consume milk as soon as possible (use oily paper and alkali for saponification to reduce toxicity) or lemon juice (acidic food neutralizes its alkalinity) to relieve symptoms
But there may be no way to recover from the burn

Small thoughts:
1. In the future, a real person acting as a scientist may be able to add a little more about the scientistâ€™s characteristics or acting style in the information column, or mention how XXX is in the plot. Otherwise, you donâ€™t know why you chose to interpret this role in this way.
2. If it is difficult for a real person to interpret a scientist, is there a part that is purely animated, and some representative animated characters can be used to explain the principle? (a bit like Taiwan), on the one hand, this can save every change of costume , Time to think about real-life scripts. On the one hand, you can focus on animation.
(Or you can refer to the episodes of Taiwan Bar Experimental Science Bar to see if you can intersperse characters and experimental animations more vividly)
The above thoughts are purely personal opinions and are for reference only. I wish the LIS team grow stronger and stronger.

@rou zuch Thank you for your explanation!! I am actually not against the dialogue between funny and humor. I just feel that the current setting is a bit like assigning lines to characters that will appear in the plot. There will be a certain dramatic effect, but I donâ€™t know. The real traits of that character are not deeply memorable.
(It feels a bit like every character speaks similar words or current affairs)

For example, in Super Junior 03: Faraday, the Secret Guest of Electricity, you can see that Faraday shows his enthusiasm by chanting poetry and writing right when he is excited, and taking scientific issues super seriously.
Or some scientists say that they did not perform well in school when they were young, and they might be able to interpret the feeling of being more naughty or living in their own world.
If your organization can add elements like this kind of personal traits when interpreting scientists, it may not only help students have more memory of different scientists, but also bring out what kind of contributions these scientists have made because of the traits of these scientists. and many more.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Hello~
The point is that cup, there are two important points
1. Fill the cup with aqueous electrolyte solution -> conductive
2. A hole is opened under the cup, and a copper wire is connected -> the battery can be connected to form a path
and so:
1. The copper wire in contact with the aqueous solution is energized and generates a magnetic field
2. The black thing in the middle is a powerful bar magnet, which also has a magnetic field

The two magnetic fields will repel each other, and the copper wire will therefore rotate. The direction of rotation is exactly the opposite of the direction of the circular magnetic field of the copper wire. A circular magnetic field similar to a copper wire hits a wall and moves in the opposite direction under the influence of the reaction force.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Hello! There is no problem with the video content!
The simple way to understand is to use Ampereâ€™s right hand rule,
Draw the magnetic field lines between the two parallel wires to see the direction.

For example, there are currents in the same direction on two parallel wires A and B,
Use Ampere's right hand to rule after the comparison, You will find that the direction of the magnetic field lines between the two wires is opposite.

If the magnetic field line of A is upward in the middle of the two wires,
Then the magnetic field line of B is downward in the middle of the two wires.

Let us recall the definition of the magnetic field line, which is the line segment from the N pole to the S pole, This definition can actually be interpreted as every point on the magnetic line of force can be regarded as a small magnet (magnetic moment),

The N pole of these small magnets is in the direction of the arrow, and the S pole is in the opposite direction of the arrow..

Every point on the line of magnetic force can be regarded as a small magnet,
Let's go back to the magnetic field line between the two wires just drawn,
The magnetic field lines of the two wires in the middle are in opposite directions,
It means that there are two strip magnets with opposite NS poles in the middle, Therefore, the two will attract each other.


Similarly, when two parallel wires have currents in opposite directions,
It is equivalent to having two strip magnets with the same NS pole direction in the middle, Therefore, the two will repel each other.


In addition, the actual electromagnetic field interaction is not so simple
As mentioned at the beginning, this is the "easy way to understand",
If you need a deeper understanding, You can search for "magnetic moment"~

author: PEACE LOVE Kim
text_en:
@LIS Situational Science Textbook

Hmm, Iâ€™m sorry I didnâ€™t modify the words in particular. Just as you said, when children are very good at learning, they donâ€™t know where to tell jokes. Even if you want to make teaching fun, I think there are many ways, but If it is funny violence or words that will make the child imitate, we adults know when to say and when to do it, but the child doesnâ€™t understand. I used to teach English to a child whose parents were not carefully accompanied. He often watches YouTube. , Except for my own question, the answers to me are stools, idiots, and walk away, so I think you understand what I mean. I hope you can make better progress and produce better teaching materials. It is also hard work. I am sure of the educational significance of this topic. Itâ€™s easy for children to absorb, but the process needs to be adjusted. I think itâ€™s more suitable.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Hello, I am sorry to make you have these doubts after reading.
I would like to explain to you that those are the funny sections that we arranged, mainly to make the children find it interesting and amusing, and they are willing to continue watching, not as boring and boring as ordinary teaching videos.
These funny sections are also exaggerated performances based on the original historical facts. For example, because Newton had a story in history because he was hit by an apple, he came up with universal gravitation. So when he was teaching students the acceleration of things falling, there would be In a word, I was beaten until I felt the feeling, and there was a bridge that exaggerated him to throw things at the students.
I'm sorry that these bridges will cause such misunderstanding and influence. We also know that when children are young, they may not be able to distinguish jokes and make wrong imitations. In the future, we will also pay attention to these funny scales in production to make the performance interesting and appropriate.

â€‹ @å†¯æ°ç‰ Provide your reply as follows:

Portaâ€™s main work is Magia Naturalis. The content in this book contains a description of magnetism. If you are interested, you can refer to the literature or read the English translation of Magia Naturalis, which can be found on the Wiki.

You can refer to the literature about Porta and Gilbert's affairs. Generally, Gilbert saw Portaâ€™s description of magnetic force in Portaâ€™s natural magic, and found it strange, so he started to communicate with Porta. Here we have strengthened the film. The history of this communication, combined with some barnyard official historians, said that they had confronted each other before, and this film was formed.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
It is the equivalent of "work" and "energy", so as long as it is the action of force, it can be converted into joules (energy form). This feeling is like pouring the same glass of water into different-shaped cups. Although they look different, they are all the same glass of water.

This phenomenon occurs because the real development of physics is not linear, nor is it independent concepts like the textbooks. The concept of energy was used by his dead opponent Leibni as early as the Newtonian period. I propose that it was called "vitality" at the time.

Before Newtonian mechanics dominated the world, Leibniz's "vitality" and Newton's "force" competed against each other for the true "mechanics". Finally, because of the non-conservation of inelastic collision energy, the "force" proposed by Newton prevailed.

(Supplement: The reasons mentioned above are records in official history, but "personally think" this does not constitute the main reason for rejection, and Newton must also know the rationality of vitality. Will Newton not know the consumption caused by friction? Newton The third law of motion proposed is one of the keys (virtual work principle) that allows future generations to connect the mechanical system and the energy system. As for why Newton won in the end, there are many aspects to discuss, we only need to know this Victory does not simply come from "who's theory is better", there are other non-scientific ideas mixed in it.)

Whether it is "vitality" (energy) or "force" (force), when they were first invented, they all wanted to describe the same thing, that is, "the reason for the movement of an object." In essence, there is no conflict between the two. In terms of correctness, the two are exactly the same.

After the authority of Newtonian mechanics faded, people began to realize that using Newton's third law of motion to transform mechanics problems would be particularly useful in some complex situations. At this time, under the guidance of Jura, the greatest mathematician in history, his student La Grange finally completed a very abstract theory that requires a certain mathematical ability to understand-"analytic mechanics", which is used in analytical mechanics. The calculated "Lagrangian quantity" is the form of "energy" (or work). After that, another person named Hamilton derives the "Hamiltonian quantity" from the "Lagrangian quantity". This The "Hamiltonian quantity" directly describes the law of conservation of energy. Of course, all of this is derived from mathematics. It precedes any empirical research and is at least 10 years earlier.

The above paragraph just shows that the essence of "energy" and "work (effect of force)" are the same, and the same is correct, so no matter how you derive, the result will be the same, but the point of view is different, you can learn from the reaction force, virtual work To understand it in the broad sense of force, it can also be understood from potential energy and kinetic energy.

After that, Coriolis who proposed the Coriolis force proposed to invent the definition of "work" based on the tradition of Newtonian mechanics, and explored the relationship between "work" and "vitality". Younger, who saw the phenomenon of interference, redefines "vitality" It is "kinetic energy". With the development of thermodynamics, concepts such as "thermodynamic theory" and "potential energy" continue to appear. Finally, under Joule's experiment and Heimholtz's precise discussion, the law of conservation of energy is completed, "energy" And "force" is regarded as two ways of describing motion phenomena.

author: skyçƒˆç„°ç„šé¢¨
text_en:
A small addition, molecular weight = the sum of the atomic weights of the atoms contained in the molecular formula
For example, CO2 (carbon dioxide), C (carbon) has an atomic weight of 12, and O (oxygen) has an atomic weight of 16.
So the molecular weight (atomic weight) of CO2 = 44
But many people misunderstand that molecules = atoms, but they are not
Mass Ã· (molecular weight) = number of moles, number of moles Ã— 6Ã—10 to the 23rd power = molecule
Mass Ã· (atomic weight) = number of moles, number of moles Ã— 6Ã—10 to the power of 23 = atom
(Do you understand this way)

author: é™³èƒ¤é”
text_en:
Recap:
The ancient Greek royal family gave Archimedes a problem. Under the principle of not scratching the crown, know whether the crown is made of pure gold! ? Archimedes, a great genius who knows astronomy and mathematics and physics, began to calculate some complicated calculations, which looks super awesome! But why does he want to strip naked and rush out to hurt everyone's eyes?

One day a craftsman made a plastic crown, but the queen thought it was a fake der (not enough funds, please cooperate)
Later, he asked Archimedes to find out whether the yellow crown was true or not (otherwise he would be killed)
Later, he used the principle of buoyancy to measure the weight of the yellow crown
It is found that the yellow crown is fake (it is fake at first glance)
Then the craftsman was decapitatedğŸ’€
Later, she also used the principle of leverage
Let a bunch of oppas take a bunch of mirrors (?)
Repulse the Roman (?) Army
Later killed by the soldiers in the city (the hateful soldier)ğŸ˜¡ğŸ˜¡ğŸ˜¡
(It seems that this soldier killed a good thing)
Archimedesâ€™ wisdom has made countless contributions to society

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Sorry, I will reply you later!
Hope the following answers have answered your doubts~

It is indeed impossible to classify organic and inorganic simply by the presence or absence of carbon. Carbon dioxide is an example. Although there is carbon, it is inorganic.
And, as you said, you thought that only biological compounds can be synthesized. With the evolution of science, it is now possible to synthesize organic compounds artificially.

The possible reasons for the need to distinguish between organic and inorganic chemistry are as follows:

1. The similarity between the functional group and the carbon structure: something like "-OH" hanging on a similar carbon structure can determine the properties of the compound, but it must be attached to the carbon chain or carbon ring to have an effect, and this is A major selling point of organic compounds, therefore, "organic chemistry" may be more appropriately called "carbon chemistry".

2. Although it can be artificially synthesized, there is no doubt that organic compounds are closely related to living organisms.

3. Common high-molecular polymers in daily life are organic compounds, such as petroleum, rubber, starch, etc., only a small part of high-molecular polymers are inorganic compounds, such as glass, gems, and semiconductors. Its structure is similar to that of organic polymers and can be regarded as replacing the original tetravalent carbon with tetravalent silicon.

Therefore, the reason why organic chemistry can become an independent discipline in chemistry is that the particularity of the structure of organic compounds leads to its ever-changing characteristics due to differences in linkages and structures.

This is actually something called "Hero's Fountain"
It is because after the water is in PET bottle c, the water in PET bottle c flows to PET bottle a, pushing the air in PET bottle a to PET bottle b, and then the air in PET bottle b pushes the air in PET bottle b. The drink came out, so the drink spurted out!
In fact, there is another reason because water has potential energy when it flows from a high place, so a series of upward movements can only be carried out after it flows down.
Did Yan Ba hide both PET bottles a and b in the box, leaving only PET bottles c and the tube from which the drink was sprayed out?

Add vanilla extract and white sugar and start boiling until the liquid is thick
Take the custard sauce and use the cooling method in the film to make (remember to add the same amount of whipped cream)
You can get creamy vanilla ice cream

author: JadeDragon Wu
text_en:
I appreciate the use of stories to bring out the spirit of physics
However, from a parentâ€™s point of view, this article is a bit inappropriate for children. I really hope to redo it.
1. Archimedes casually took children home
2. There are some "open yellow accents", although they are not open, but I don't know the meaning. Kids can't laugh at all
Some other suggestions
a. Some modern experiments point out that Archimedes is unlikely to make the feat of burning a ship. Itâ€™s just a legend.
b. The child took out the lens and burned the leaves on the ground. It should be a good opportunity to bring out the children at home and school to do experiments by themselves.
c. The element of fire is pretty cool history. However, in the interpretation of the copy, it seems that it is not emphasized that this is the wrong way of thinking in ancient Greece. For children, it is not suitable for children to overemphasize repetition.


The spirit is really commendable, but maybe a little online celebrity? Too close to the 20/30-year-old joke. Although I laugh every time I see Brother How, it doesn't mean that I will show Brother How to my children. I sincerely hope that LIS can hire some parents, starting from the perspective of children, and really getting close to the user group. Come on!

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Hello, thank you very much for giving us so many suggestions!
1. Regarding the jokes on the script, I will pass it on to our screenwriter.
The writing of scripts is indeed something we have been adjusting. The difficult content of the history of science must be written into an easy-to-understand plot, but it must not only make it easy for children to understand, but also make children like to watch and want to continue watching.
In order to achieve this goal, we will design some laughs, but the laughs must be just right. We understand that some laughs may be just jokes and dramatic effects for adults, but in the minds of immature children, there may be Doubts about being taken seriously or imitated.
We have spent a lot of effort on each script, and we will finalize it after many meetings and discussions. Thank you very much for your comments, and we will pay more attention to this aspect!
2. The historical content, there are stories about legends, and the scientific assumptions that you pointed out that have been determined to be wrong speculations. We will make better explanations in this part, so that children should not be misunderstood.
3. Regarding the idea of adding a child to experiment, we actually pulled him out and filmed it into another independent experimental video, which was included in our "LIS Lab" series.
4. Finding a parent counselor is a good idea, and we will take it into consideration for future planning!

Thank you again for your comments and encouragement! ! LIS will continue to work hard and produce more good scientific content!

text_en:
Thatâ€™s right~ The phlogistonistâ€™s way of explaining that the burning of metals will become heavier is to assume that phlogiston is lighter than air, but this assumption is more like a reason to be found out to explain the weight, and the gases found in the phlogiston system are all One problem is that it is possible to find substances derived from phlogiston such as "dephlogisticated gas" and "phlogisticated gas", but no matter how to find it, it is impossible to find phlogiston. In the end, phlogiston is not strictly speaking. The oxidation theory was defeated because scientists who believed that phlogiston believed that phlogiston existed before they died, but under the influence of time, the phlogiston theory of "phlogiston" could not be found, and it can only be eliminated by the more complete oxidation theory.
In the film, Lava Festival did not agree with the phlogiston theory to explain the phenomenon of metal combustion, and then developed the oxidation theory. From now on, Lava Energy-saving thinking outside the original framework is really quite powerful.

author: å°å¨
text_en:
Sorry, I will do a supplementary XD about the history related to physical chemistry
This is the so-called voltaic battery. A long time ago, there was an Italian doctor named Luigi Galvani. When he was dissecting a frog one day, he found that every time the knife was used, the frogâ€™s feet would With a beating, he called this phenomenon animal electricity. Alessandro Volta thought that since the frog's feet are electrical conductors, they are also current detectors.
He replaced the frog's feet with paper soaked in salt water and used other methods to detect the current. He discovered the law that the electromotive force of the galvanic cell is equal to the difference between the potentials of the two electrodes. This is known as the law of Volta in later generations.
Remarks: Two different metals and one electrolyte must be used. Electrolytes such as Shupao, blood, sodium hydroxide aqueous solution, and sulfuric acid are all electrolytes.
There are many types of batteries nowadays, including rechargeable and non-rechargeable batteries. Rechargeable: lithium batteries, accumulators, etc. in your mobile phone; non-rechargeable: dry batteries, wet batteries, alkaline batteries, etc. ; As long as the doubts about batteries on the market are made of two different metals and one electrolyte.
Remarks: The electrolyte of alkaline batteries is related to the addition of manganese dioxide and starch, so the electrolyte of alkaline batteries will be thick. Once a non-rechargeable battery is charged, it is extremely likely to be dangerous. You can disassemble the batteries in your home at home, but it is recommended not to disassemble alkaline batteries, because the electrolyte of alkaline batteries is a strong alkali, and lead batteries are also recommended not because the electrolyte is sulfuric acid, nickel-cadmium batteries and nickel-metal hydride batteries It is recommended not to disassemble, because the electrolyte is also strong alkali XD

author: æ­¸è™›
text_en:
Haha, take a look at the current. I believe it should be below 0.1A to charge the mobile phone. It will be full in about 10-20 hours...
And if the battery is not sealed, the electrolyte will volatilize, so pay attention to replenish moisture every two to four hours...
To add, over time the electrolyte decreases, the electrode corrodes and the current also decreases, so the charging time may increase to 20~40 hours...In addition, it should be noted that the paper-electrolyte of each layer should not be in contact with each other, otherwise it will be regarded as a short circuit.

Uh... I remember that this seems to be taught in the school. When the electric energy is constant, the higher the voltage, the smaller the current, and the lower the voltage, the higher the current. The high-voltage wire consumes low, the low-voltage wire consumes high, and the side effect of high wire consumption is To generate heat, the solution is to increase the wire diameter, so when the power is sent out, the power plant will send 345KV directly. This is the reason. The high voltage and low current wire consumes low, and there is no need for too thick wires, so as to reduce the power transmission cost.

author: è‘‰ä¿Šå»·
text_en:
This is an oxidation-reduction reaction to help high school students review

Redox activity
The order of oxidation number from large to small is as follows: lithium rubidium potassium cesium barium strontium calcium sodium magnesium aluminum manganese zinc chromium iron cobalt nickel tin lead hydrogen copper mercury silver platinum

The larger the oxidation number, the easier it is to lose electrons. It is an oxidation reaction and a reducing agent.
The smaller the oxidation number, the easier it is to get electrons. It is a reduction reaction and an oxidant.

Therefore, aluminum is easier to lose electrons than copper, and copper is easier to get electrons and becomes a current, so the phone can be charged.

If you can, please explain it clearly. Thank you

I hope this test love test will help you
I wish you all the test takers success

author: tber
text_en:
The film said that when copper and aluminum are in contact, metal aluminum tends to throw electrons to metal copper. I donâ€™t think itâ€™s correct.
Copper metal is quite stable, and the chemically active copper ion (Cu2+)
If you want to make an aluminum copper battery (Al || Cu2+), there must be copper ions in the electrolyte, but there is only metal copper in the film
As the film owner said above, there should be a potential difference between the metal aluminum and the hydrogen ions in the water for oxidation and reduction.
Aluminum is oxidized to aluminum ions, and hydrogen ions are reduced to hydrogen
Theoretically speaking, changing the role of the cathode of a copper coin to a carbon rod or gold to conduct electricity has the same effect (voltage).
The only difference is that if you use gold, it looks better.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Hello everyone, I am Lubian
Let me help you clarify the terminology you use
It is actually controversial to say "oxidation number" here.
Correctly speaking, the oxidation number represents the degree of oxidation
That is, the degree of loss of electrons (how many electrons were robbed)
So itâ€™s actually harder to lose electrons if the oxidation number is high
I think what the poster wants to say is "active", right?
Reactivity represents the tendency of a substance to lose electrons. The greater the activity, the more likely it is to lose electrons.
But this tendency does not mean the quantity is also opposite to the tendency of oxidation number performance.
So I hope you donâ€™t confuse "activity" with "oxidation number"!
As for the reactions at the poles
That is, aluminum loses electrons (oxidation reaction) to produce aluminum ions
Copper gets electrons (reduction reaction), but since copper metal is not short of electrons, these electrons will be given to the cations in the solution
At this time, the only cations in the solution are hydrogen ions, sodium ions, and aluminum that has just been oxidized.
Sodium itself is extremely active (I want to lose electrons very much), so it becomes quite stable after becoming sodium ions
The distance between the oxidized aluminum (aluminum ion) itself and the copper electrode is not as good as the other two cations in the solution.
So the copper electrode will provide the electron to the hydrogen ion after receiving the electron
Let hydrogen ions get electrons (reduction reaction) into hydrogen
Therefore, the copper itself will not be reduced here, but the hydrogen ions will be reduced!

author: é»ƒä¿Šç¿”
text_en:
Jun Tingye, can you explain the definition of oxidation number?
It seems different from what I learned
In what i learned
Metal activity sorting is also called metal oxidation potential sorting
The higher the oxidation potential, the easier it is to oxidize

During the reaction, if the oxidation number of an element increases, it will undergo an oxidation reaction; conversely, if the oxidation number of an element decreases, it will undergo a reduction reaction.
So the larger the oxidation number, the easier it is to reduce as an oxidant
       The smaller the oxidation number, the easier it is to oxidize as a reducing agent
In this reaction
Aluminum is more active than copper and has a higher oxidation potential
When the reducing agent itself oxidizes and acts as an anode to produce aluminum ions
In this experiment, sodium chloride, the electrolyte, only helps pure water conduct electricity
And it is not copper that is reduced at the cathode
Nor is it the chloride ion or sodium ion dissociated by sodium chloride
But the water itself is reduced to produce hydrogen
The younger brother is shallow in learning
Hope to teach

author: tber
text_en:
First of all, Na+ will never be reduced in water
Because the reduction potential of Na+ is lower than the reduction potential of water, water will compete successfully when competing for the reduction half-reaction, so it is water reduction.
From another point of view, if Na+ is really reduced, metal Na will be reduced.
Metal Na is active and reacts violently when it meets water, turning back to Na+ and producing hydrogen
So the result is that the hydrogen is reduced
If Na+ is restored, you will probably see the battery burn up or even explode. Itâ€™s terrifying.

author: tber
text_en:
Oxidation and reduction must happen at the same time and end at the same time
That is, if someone loses an electron, someone will pick it up
Metal aluminum loses electrons (oxidation), then someone must pick up those electrons
The ionic copper may receive electrons (reduction). The metal copper is already in the element state and will no longer receive electrons. So it is someone else who receives the electrons.
Now list the substances that have the opportunity to receive electrons (reduction):
 Na+ or Cl- or water
Reduction to oxidation number decreased Cl- oxidation number is -1, which has reached the lowest value and can no longer be reduced
Na+ is extremely stable in water and will not be restored
So only water can be restored by electrons
You can think of water as H+ + OH-
The O oxidation number of OH- is -2 has reached the lowest value and will not be reduced
So now the only thing that can be reduced is H+ to reduce and produce hydrogen H2

This is a course that should be taught in high school redox and chemical batteries
If you havenâ€™t touched it before, you may still be a bit distant
Itâ€™s okay if you donâ€™t understand well, this world doesnâ€™t need everyone to study chemistry
Hope it helps you

text_en:
Your eyes are really sharp!!
That's right~~ This props thesis is a research done by Arenis after winning the award
Arianis, who originally studied electrolytes, turned to more different fields in the later stage of the research.
This paper like this is mainly about the influence of carbonic acid (carbon dioxide) on atmospheric temperature
As for why this paper was chosen?
Because Lu Fu, who wrote the text, said that he has not found the original paper on the ionization theory of Arenis.
So the props are first replaced by other papers by Arenis
Lu Fu is still looking for this award-winning paper
I wonder if anyone found this paper and would like to share it with Lu Fu?
Lu Fu begged everyone in front of the computer XD

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
That's right! Phlogiston said that the same explanation method is only valid on metals, but other objects have no way. Moreover, the phlogiston that phlogiston chemists were looking for was not actually found in the end, and the discovery of oxygen officially gave a complete explanation of the two conditions. Not only that, oxygen also explains other phenomena. Compared with phlogiston, which can only explain combustion and contradictions, the oxidation theory of Lava knot is closer to the observations of the real world.
However, Phlogiston said it did not disappear directly, but it took some time before it was slowly eliminated by science.

author: é™³èƒ¤é”
text_en:
The seventeenth century was called the century of genius. At that time, apart from the century known as the genius, there was another very important thing. The alchemy with a long history began to decline at this time. It was not until two hundred years later*1 that it officially left the world stage. . We all know that Boyle broke people's myths about the old age by relying on a "skeptical chemist". But how can the technology, logic and deep-rooted thinking that have lasted for more than a thousand years be reversed overnight? What we are going to talk about today is the transitional product of alchemy to modern science-Phlogiston theory.

But to truly understand alchemy and modern science, you must first abandon some meta-cognitions and think from a contemporary perspective. The first thing that needs to be broken is the mysterious and weird impression of alchemy. Alchemy is indeed a mystery, but the reason for its mystery is that if it is put in modern times, it actually contains a lot of theology, semiotics, occult, psychology, and medicine. Such a complicated system naturally casts a layer of mystery when outsiders don't understand it. But for contemporary people, alchemy is not superstition or deceit, but a system that has been circulated for a long time. Just as we now take earth sciences and physics for granted. In other words, if you just ask a commoner in the seventeenth century, who is more unbelievable between an alchemist and a doctor, maybe most people will pick a doctor wearing a contemporary beak.

The science at that time was not like it is now. Every academic discipline has no boundaries. Physicists, chemists, and biologists can only study their own fields. On the contrary, almost every scientist lives in each field. In the field. John Joachim Becher (hereinafter referred to as Becher) of Germany was also a doctor, explorer, economist, alchemist, and chemist at the same time*2. He has developed in so many fields. He has published language books, animal and plant mineral encyclopedias, and also served as the archbishopâ€™s personal doctor and the emperorâ€™s economic adviser. He is completely referring to the advanced level of the triple crown in the first, second and third categories. Version. Not only that, he also delivered a speech on the authenticity of the sage's stone.

At the same time Becher argued that substances generally contain three components. They are: "rock soil" that exists in solids, the harder the content is, the "mercury soil" contained in fluid substances, and the "oil soil" that controls the burning ability of combustible objects. These three kinds of soil coincidentally correspond to the characteristics of the three elements "salt," "mercury," and "sulfur." The substance may be composed of two or even three kinds of soil at the same time, and burning is the decomposition effect of separating oily soil from other soils.

Becher's combustion theory has an old problem that is still common to alchemy, which is to explain a single phenomenon with a huge theory, which is not applicable to various situations. For example, it is impossible to explain why air is needed for combustion, and why metal burns to separate oil and soil, but the weight increases *3. Moreover, it only stays at observing and explaining phenomena, but there is no experimental and data basis to endorse the theory. But this theory still took the first step of modern science: it was to separate the theology, semiotics and so on in alchemy, leaving only pure chemistry.

At the same time, this theory influenced Becher's student-Georg Ernst Starr (hereinafter referred to as Starr). As mentioned in the previous article, there was no clear distinction between the academic disciplines at that time, although Stahl studied medicine next to Becher, later entered the medical school, and even became the imperial physician*4. But Starr also inherited Becher's combustion theory and changed the original oily soil to phlogiston. The difference between phlogiston and oily soil is that phlogiston is a kind of particles that are lighter than air. These particles are very lively and constitute the basis of combustion, and the flame we see is the result of a large number of particles gathering*5.

The difference from Becher is that phlogiston can no longer only explain a single phenomenon, but can explain almost everything that happens during combustion. For example, the reason why air is needed for combustion is because objects cannot directly release phlogiston, but need air to receive *6. Just like transferring money, you must have another personâ€™s account to receive your money, otherwise the money cannot be transferred out. As for why the metal becomes heavier after burning? As mentioned earlier, phlogiston is a particle lighter than air. After the phlogiston leaves the metal, the air fills the original gap, so the metal naturally becomes heavier. At the same time, metal rusts and becomes heavier, also because the phlogiston slowly leaves the metal. Not only that, the smelting of metals can also use the phlogiston in the charcoal to transfer to the burned metal slag to explain why the metal slag turns back into a metal. Stahl even speculates that plants can absorb phlogiston, and phlogiston will be transferred to animals through the food chain, and eventually phlogiston will circulate in nature. This is why there is no day when phlogiston is used up and cannot be burned*7.

Stahl's phlogiston theory surpassed his teacher Becher. It has taken the second step of modern science, that is, a single theory can explain all similar situations, not a single phenomenon. Such advanced methods and theories have convinced the contemporary generation of Starr's phlogiston theory, and some even called it the phlogiston period*8. But this theory actually has a fatal flaw, that is, it lacked quantitative and repeatable experiments. When accurate measurement is not possible, too large experimental errors will easily make the phlogiston theory lack an accurate theoretical basis. For example, phlogiston is lighter than air, which makes the metal become heavier after being burned by air. This statement does not apply to the burning of wood with more voids*9.

Although the phlogiston theory was later overthrown by the oxidation theory discovered by Lava Jie, it ended a period when scientific development was hindered by the wrong theory*10. But in the history of science, the phlogiston theory is not useless, but plays an important process in which people have just left alchemy and stumbled towards modern science. At the same time, it is also a reference to remind future scientists that they need to be more careful and rigorous in science.

ï¼Š2: Wikipedia <Becher> (The Sageâ€™s Stone is mentioned in the German version)
ï¼Š3: Wikipedia <Stal> (Stal only explains these)
ï¼Š4: The same as the part of the life of ï¼Š3
*5: Various viewpoints on the nature of combustion
ï¼Š6: Phlogiston cannot be decomposed automatically, and air must be used to absorb phlogiston
ï¼Š7: Phlogiston has weight, but it is very light-lighter than air (the rest of the wiki also has it)
ï¼Š8: Phlogiston period
*9: Same as *7
ï¼Š10: Dephlogiston gas

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Yes, I have done my homework. Mercury 197 will naturally decay into gold 197. If you are interested in the intermediate process, please refer to the Wiki entry on "Electronic Capture".

But since mercury 197 will naturally decay into gold 197, why does mercury 197 still exist in nature? All things become gold, right?

There are seven kinds of mercury elements stably existing in nature, namely mercury 196, mercury 198, mercury 199, mercury 200, mercury 201, mercury 202, and mercury 204. There is no mercury 197.

To make mercury 197, the easiest way (not simple at all) is to inject the mercury 198 that exists in nature into gamma rays, shoot out a neutron, and wait for the mercury 197 to decay into gold 197.

As for the intensity of gamma rays to be injected, I don't know, but it is theoretically feasible.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
The main difference is that "particles collide, and waves interfere."
Before explaining what collision and interference are, let me tell a story:

Pretend we are western cowboys in a duel
We drew our guns for a duel, the scene was extremely hot
I hid behind the bunker to avoid the bullet
You shoot and ask me to surrender
I heard the loud sound of your shooting
And your faint voice

I know the story is not good
However, when I think hiding behind a bunker can block bullets
It shows that I think bullets have particle characteristics
Will be offset by hitting the bunker, which is a collision

I hid behind the bunker, you still yell at me
This means you know that the sound will not be blocked by the cover
The sound should not have particle properties.

Then, you shot and shouted
I heard huge gunfire and small clamor
Both voices reached my ears
It sounds like a combination of two voices
This is interference, two sounds can be stacked together
But two bullets should not be able to stack together
They will collide and cause reflections or crushing phenomena

If you are interested in what happens to waves and particles, you can look at the counterattack of the physical line optics Hooke and Newton's counterattack.

text_en: Invisible Man Hydrogen peroxide is basically used to offset the effect of vitamin C. However, the concentration of hydrogen peroxide in general pharmacies is very low, but the concentration of vitamin C is very high. Hydrogen peroxide is naturally no match for a large amount of vitamin C, so we will dilute vitamin C. Just make the color disappear on the paper so that there wonâ€™t be too many vitamins on the paper

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Vitamin C makes betadine transparent
We had the same situation as you before
The first is to dilute betadine, because lemons have a limited vitamin C content. Directly using pure betadine will cause too much iodine and lemon vitamin C is not enough to make all the iodine disappear, so make it thinner to make the iodine less.
The second is to use vitamin C ingots. This kind of vitamin C is super-rich, and it will be effective after a few tens of seconds after applying it.

author: é™³å®¥èŠ¯
text_en: The temperature of dry ice is minus 78 degrees and metal is about 25 degrees. When the metal spoon comes into contact with dry ice, the difference between the two temperatures is about 100 degrees, causing a large amount of carbon dioxide to be produced on the contact surface of the dry ice and the spoon, and the spoon is pushed away from the surface of the dry ice . After the spoon leaves the surface of the dry ice, it drops due to its weight and comes into contact with the dry ice again. Carbon dioxide is generated again and pushed away. Repeatedly, vibration and sound are generated.

text_en:
Circles are a simplified way of describing atoms.
In fact, the atom is not round, and the electron cloud is very rich in shape, especially after the molecules are bonded, the electron cloud can take the shape of a figure of eight, a tetrahedron... and so on.
The distribution probability of these electron clouds can be calculated by quantum mechanics.

text_en: I want to ask if you have cooled the water because after I did it, I found that the effect is not very significant. I want to say that the water temperature is lowered and the result is successful.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en: Do not use the glass to bake it directly. If you simply use a microwave to heat the water, the glass bottle will be up to 100 degrees, and it will not heat up and shrink when placed in cold water. In cold water, sudden temperature changes can easily break due to thermal expansion and contraction.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en: In fact, it is not necessary to cool the water, but the lower the temperature of the water, the better the effect of air liquefaction in the bottle. The closer the bottle is to the vacuum, the better the effect of natural water absorption.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en: The flame color is that the electrons in the substance gain energy and then return to the ground state to release energy and then emit light. The process does not involve molecular rearrangement. The flame color should be a physical change; but the flame color reaction will be accompanied by redox, and the molecules rearrange to form oxides. Therefore, the whole process should be a chemical change.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Thank you for your suggestion~
But in this episode of alchemy, we mainly discuss exploring the world in a scientific way
Does not mean to belittle religion
There is no question of right or wrong for a role like God
From a scientific point of view, we cannot say that God definitely does not exist
But in these contents, we are more focused on breaking the superstition and facing the real world in a rational way of thinking.
There is no denial of religion
But simply discuss it with the special rituals of the past

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
Yes, precipitation and dissolution are opposite processes. Sodium acetate will freeze when it dissolves (absorb external heat), so when sodium acetate runs out, it will release the absorbed heat, so it will feel very hot.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
1. It is recommended to continue heating to ensure that the sodium acetate is dissolved.
2. After dissolving, be sure to put into another clean container, make sure that there is no sodium acetate solid on the edge of the container, because some are invisible to the naked eye, but in fact, it is safer to replace it with a new one.
3. If the particles still appear, it is recommended to cover it (to prevent crystallization from falling into the air) and then let it stand to cool.
We used cold water to speed up the temperature before, and the probability of failure was high. This experiment is completely in rush~~~

Water 1 sodium acetate 3 ratio, we can do it ourselves XDDD
For the raw materials, we have tried all white and yellow sodium acetate, but light yellow ones canâ€™t be made. We need pure white sodium acetate.

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
ã€Why is learning so efficient? ã€‘
The short video of the founder Yan Tianhao on the big figures of the future is out!
Friends who have never had the opportunity to hear Tianhao's own founding philosophy, Xiaobian Wudi recommends everyone to take 20 minutes to watch this short talk together. He used a very interesting and vivid metaphor to describe the problems in Taiwan's education.
In the short talk, Tian Hao mentioned: "Why should our learning be so efficient?" We extracted the knowledge that we think students should learn, cut off the connection between them and life, and then put it into the textbook. We thought it was rid of it. Cun Jing's good intentions also indirectly cut off the students' willingness to learn.
After the short talk, a high school student came to take a photo with Tian Hao, saying that after listening to his short talk, he felt that he had gained a lot. In addition to being flattered, the editor is also full of touch.
I remember that when we were young, we always liked to climb on the shoulders of our parents. We wanted to see farther and closer to the height of adults. Since we were young, we have the ability to be curious and explore. Education has never been just a transfer from top to bottom. Now, we want to return the learning space to children so that they can learn slowly in the right way!
-------------------------------------------------- ------
[Interview with the Age of Great Love Awakening] http://goo.gl/CgOuJm
[LIS website] http://www.learningissharing.com/

Bacteria are responsible for decomposition ğŸ’© belong to the decomposer
Bacteria donâ€™t eat sulphur, they just decompose sulphur.
Because ğŸ’© contains nutrients, bacteria can eat it to get nutrients
Exactly meet:
Conditions for decomposing corpses to obtain nutrients
So bacteria are decomposers
But itâ€™s not an exaggeration to say that he is a consumer
Because ğŸ’©Because it can also be regarded as organic
It just fits: ...eat other organic matter (animals, plants...) to survive

author: LISæƒ…å¢ƒç§‘å­¸æ•™æ
text_en:
+Xia Qin
Xiaobian will answer this question for you

Consumers (foreign organisms): unable to synthesize the nutrients needed by the sun or inorganic substances in nature, and must rely on eating other organic substances (animals, plants...) to survive

Producer (self-supporting organisms): can use sunlight, carbon dioxide in the air, water and inorganic substances to convert them into nutrients they need.

Sulfur-eating bacteria are not classified as consumers because they eat sulfide (inorganic salt) instead of other animals, plants or organic matter.

Wikipedia link: https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%87%AA%E5%85%BB%E7%94%9F%E7%89%A9

author: Book11çš„ä¸–ç•Œ
text_en:
Item 3 is also wrong!!
1. Atoms are composed of electrons, protons and neutrons, so atoms are not the smallest particles
2. The isotopic properties are the same but the quality can be different. Same quantity, different digitization but same quality
3. Part of the superconductor or part of the crystal lattice is defective, so that the interatomic length does not exist in an integer ratio. ex: NiO (insulator) & Ni0.97O (semiconductor) -> also known as non-quantitative compounds
   (Of course the atom will not be cut in half, but the atom will not be cut in half and whether it is an integer ratio is basically two different things -> see average molecular weight and average chemical formula for details)
4. During a nuclear reaction, the type and number of atoms will change
So Atom says all 4 items must be revised
